p: We conducted a 2-y trial in Manacapuru, a 60,000-inhabitant city (~13,500 dwellings in ~650 ha) in the Brazilian Amazon (data from the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics; http://www.ibge.gov.br/) ( Fig 1). We selected 100 dwellings roughly evenly distributed across the city ( Fig 1) for mosquito surveillance including two surveys per month from February 2014 to January 2016 (except that no surveys were conducted in November 2015, and just one survey in February 2015 and January 2016; see S1 Data). Residents in these 100 dwellings gave written informed consent to participate in the study.
